reviews.sentence: Beautiful view comfortable room. We had a waterfront room with a beautiful view. The staff were all friendly and helpful. The cafe downstairs provided coffee breakfast at a reasonable price.

Spacious Room Lovely Staff. The room was spacious and clean. The staff friendly and helpful. The location close enough to walk to from Bart or take the ferry to San Francisco for a nice change. If had to find a flaw it would only be the toilet paper. The toilet paper in a portajohn at Yosemite was softer than at the Waterfront but that may be due to plumbing issues I did not ask. I had certainly recommend the hotel to others and would not hesitate to stay there again myself.

Great Staff Great Location Average Facility. I have had a good experience with other Joie de Vivre hotels but this was not a good experience. The room we had was noisy. There was lots of light leaking in from the hall way through the front door and the water pressure in the shower was low. The staff were great and very helpful. They just could not make up for the shortcomings in the facility itself. We heard TV noise from the other rooms and staff doing their cleaning work in the nearby common living room space. The location in Jack London Square is excellent and maybe other rooms do not have this problem. I would just not want this room 104 again.

Home away from home. Yes you do hear the train but I was on vacation and did not mind it at all. Yes it is an older hotel but everything was working. The keys were a challenge but we always got into our room. The service is absolutely wonderful. We had a beautiful bay view suite that overlooked the bay and Jack London Square. Our daughter who is local to the area joined us for a couple of days and stayed on the pull out sofa in the other room. She valetd her car since the parking garages fill up fast. It gets cool at night so the fireplace was a nice touch. During the day however it was warm enough to leave the deck doors open. The valet service was very helpful from parking our car driving us for free down into Oakland and getting us a limo when we were leaving for the airport. We überd to The Waterfront but were a little nervous doing the same at 430a in the morning. We enjoyed several restaurants in the area including Lungomares which we could access from inside our building. We had our breakfast down there every day. We took advantage of the ferry to San Francisco which was a stones throw away from the hotel. Below is an evening view from our room plus some photos of our room.

Worth money. Positive. very Nice staff including Ime who was helpful and serviceminded. Our Room had a partial sea view and had a balcony with furniture. The furniture was decent and the bed was comfortable the sheets were soft. There is a place Plank just next to the hotel that was great. The Ferry to the San Francisco is just 100 meters from the hotel. It costs 6 dollars. Overall very secure hotel and there is a lot of staff. The pool was heated. Negative be aware that it takes time to get to San Francisco if you decide to take subway. The immediate area that the hotel was situated was very cozy but further on it was quite a boring area. The railway is a couple of streets away the trains make a lot of warning signals when they pass by so be aware of that. However we were not disturbed in the nights. The parking is 25 dollars and there is no breakfast.

Excellent Customer Service. My wife I stayed for 4 nights. Room was spacious with all the amenities. 2 huge queen size beds microwave fridge safe and a beautiful view of the harbor. Customer service was exelent especially Ime at the front desk who was very friendly and accommodating with all our needs. Will definitely stay at the Waterfront Hotel again next time we are in the bay area.
The location was nice the staff very friendly welcoming and polite.

Great Get Away. From the minute we arrived we were greater treated like royalty. We received a lovely upgrade with a water view. The staff was wonderful very accommodating. The room was comfortable we appreciated the lovely wine sent to the room for my friends birthday. The bath products were also lovely the bathrobes were also a nice touch. The trains passing by every so often were nice to if you like that sound. If you do not you will be annoyed. The wine cheese reception was a bonus we enjoyed meeting other guests during this hour. Special shout out to Lisa at the front desk. we will return for sure.
I love staying here. Walking distance to amazing restaurants and night life. Great service and views here. I also recommend joining their rewards program free bottle of wine at check in.

Waterfront Hotel. Nice atmosphere and view of the ocean. Nice valet service too. Good accessibility to a variety of restaurants coffee shops and places of interest. We could walk to the places. I loved being so close to the Bay. My view in my bedroom was excellent. Staff were friendly especially the car parkers. They taking care of my car was so helpful.

I really enjoyed my stay at Waterfront. The view is lovely the housekeeping is great and the staff is helpful and very friendly. There ’s a beautiful boardwalk with a ferry stop and a nice pool. The only downsides are that the hotel does not have a laundry room but they do have a laundry service if that floats your goats and that room service for food is extremely pricy. The main floor of the hotel has two gender neutral bathrooms and a beautiful fireplace. The hotel is in walking distance from many great local shops and eateries. I will definitely be back when I ’m in the area.

Not Your Average Joie de Vivre. Hotel is a little tired needs some upgrades. Italian restaurant has a very unusual menu with one pasta dish with squid ink. We were there for 2 nights and never was the room cleaned. The insulation between rooms is non existent. We called the front desk because we could hear our next door neighbors TVBreakfast was a little sketchy you had to walk up to order no table service. Then find your place to sit in the bar to eat. The view from our room See comments about experience.

I was robbed by them and you. The staff was kinda helpful saying that they would try to get me in my room before the now absurd new 4 pm check in time but it was all lip service my room was n’t ready until 430 to then get into this room that took so long to clean and it was half way done bogers from someone who snoted on the wall were left beside the bed and the whole cleaning of the room did n’t have much effort for it to have taken 6 hours to clean because checkout for me was the maids banging on my door to get out the next morning at 9 am just ludicrous this place has some nerve charging me 80 a quarter of a night I ’m about done with bokingcom. Read above.

Excellent. Loved the location. Lots to do great people clubs etc. The on site restaurant was horrible in service only as nobody served us at all in the free seating bar area. Bartenders had no idea about drinks. Simple vodka cranberry tasted like old cranberry. Went to Scott ’s and it was amazing.

Disappointing. Sadly what should have been a final evening before our return to the UK was marred by noise. Trains street entertainers and other hotel guests. Not how we wish to remember the USThe receptionist who checked us in was delightful.

Joie de Vivre. The best thing about this property is it ’s proximity to Yoshi ’s. Probably the go to Hotel for that Jazz Venue. But. It ’s a tired property in need of freshening up. Run by an inexperienced staff. Room service waiters are stressed. Yada yada. Not a good value.

Renovations imposed on customers. We chose this hotel as one of few in the area that takes dogs. Lobby renovations made it stressful as well as long wIt for valet service one of the few ways to park the car. Had no idea where the temp lobby for check in was. Another guest walked me the long distance to the site. Perhaps additional staff to handle valet parking and guide people to the temp lobby would have reduced the stress. For a higher end hotel the hallways and room could have been more refreshed.

Used to be one of my favorites. This hotel used to be one of my favorites here in Oakland. Its close to good restaurants and entertainment Yoshis live music Movie Theater Bowling. But the staff management has changed and it is showing not necessarily in a good way. When calling or inquiring with the front desk staff a lot of my questions have not been answered or the staff member is too new to know the answer. They recently changed the décor of the hotel as well. It used to be unique and fun and now the interior is bland and boring. Not what you can usually expect form a Joie De Vivre property.

Beware of noisy rooms on third floor noise from upstairs. Location is great. Room 35 was horrible for the money we spent it was not worth it. I called the front desk about a noise at night they seemed aware of it and I unfortunately they were sold out at 130pm and could not move me. Guess what I arrived early at check in and I wish they did not offer this accommodation that comes with a bonus noise. Nobody took care of my complaint front desk told me they will get back to me and it ’s been a week surprisingly bad costumer service at Joie de Vivre.

Good. The location is really lovely and my room was are large. Other than that I can not say much else e about the hotel. As I mentioned below the staff was very nice but very poorly informed. It felt as if the entire staff was new minus one women and that none of them had ever worked in service before. The hotel was fine but I have never stayed in a hotel where the staff knew so little. Every question I asked whether it was how much is an average Uber ride to the airport or is there a convenience store nearby. Was met with a blank stare and an I do not know. When I asked how I get a shuttle back to the hotel that night I was told by the bellman to just call the hotel. When I asked for a card with the number on it he stared at me blankly and then ruffled through a drawer and then told me he did not have one. When I went to the front desk and asked for the same thing I was met with the same response until the manager came out and direct the young lady what to do. When I was not informed that the shuttle did not run on Saturdays after discussing with them that I would need a shuttle I was directed to an obscure sign on the wall. When I brought it up with the front desk mentioning that I now had no way to get to my location she turned the other way offer no help or solutions. I even asked the time from a maintenance person and he stared at me blankly maybe he did not speak English. I am uncertain. I do have to say they are all very nice just really uninformed. I felt like I was in some sort of hotel twilight zone. Also there are no services at the hotel so in the am there is coffee served but no tea. In the room it is the same coffee only. There is a cafe attached to the hotel but when I went there I paid close to 6 for tea.
